title: Can you do a chemistry degree with chemistry and maths A-levels? - Quora

response.answer_text: I hope not. I say that because I would hope you have at least a third A level (hopefully physics or biology). The reason I say that is that (mostly) the more difficult it is to get into a university, the better they are. Many years ago I got A level Chemistry Biology and Math (also old-school S level in Chemistry) and I had excellent choices of where to study based on offers. I declined Imperial college and went to University college London (but ironically did my PhD at Imperial).
